16-3-1.graph_title: Der Indikator gibt die Anzahl der Inhaftierten je 100.000 Einwohnerinnen und Einwohner an.
16-3-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: Ziel ist es, angesichts einer geringen Inhaftierungsquote in Schleswig-Holstein zukünftig einen Wert  von unter 40,0 zu erreichen. Die Bewertung bezieht sich auf die Daten (i.d.R. 2005 -2017) des 1. Berichts  Schleswig-Holsteins zu den UN-Nachhaltigkeitszielen. Trotz leichten Anstiegs befindet sich  Schleswig-Holstein europa- und, soweit verlässliche Vergleichsdaten vorliegen, weltweit unter den Länder mit den geringsten Gefangenenquoten. Der Norden setzt das juristische Prinzip wirksam um, Freiheitsentzug  nur als letztes Mittel anzuwenden, was nicht zuletzt kriminologischen Erkenntnissen entspricht. Es ist zu  erwarten, dass die derzeit niedrige Inhaftierungsquote stabil bleiben und mittelfristig die Zielmarke von unter 40,0 erreicht werden wird.

1-1-1.SDG_GOAL: Ziel 1: **Beenden** Sie die Armut in allen ihren Formen und überall
1-1-1.SDG_TARGET: Target 1.1: By de-2030, eradicate extreme poverty for all people everywhere, currently measured as people living on less than $1.25 a day
1-1-1.SDG_INDICATOR: Indicator 1.1.1: Proportion of the population living below the international poverty line by sex, age, employment status and geographic location (urban/rural)
1-1-1.SDG_SERIES_DESCR: Hier steht eine Beschreibung ohne Anführungsstriche
1-1-1.STAT_CONC_DEF:
## Definition:
The proportion of the employed population below the international poverty line of US$1.90 per day, also referred to as the working poverty rate, is defined as the share of employed persons living in households with per-capita consumption or income that is below the international poverty line of US$1.90.
## Concepts:
**Employment:** All persons of working age who, during a short reference period (one week), were engaged in any activity to produce goods or provide services for pay or profit.

**Poverty Line:** Threshold below which individuals in the reference population are considered poor and above which they are considered non-poor. The threshold is generally defined as the per-capita monetary requirements an individual needs to afford the purchase of a basic bundle of goods and services. For the purpose of this indicator, an absolute international poverty line of US$1.90 per day is used.

**Household in poverty:** Households are defined as poor if their income or consumption expenditure is below the poverty line taking into account the number of household members and composition (e.g., number of adults and children).

**Working poor:** Employed persons living in households that are classified as poor, that is, that have income or consumption levels below the poverty line used for measurement.

16-8-1.graph_title: Schuldenstand des Landes Schleswig-Holstein in Euro je Einwohnerin
16-8-1.STAT_CONC_DEF: Für den Indikator ist kein Zielwert festgelegt (Reporting-Indikator). Die Bewertung bezieht sich  auf die Daten (i.d.R. 2005 -2017) des 1. Berichts Schleswig-Holsteins zu den UN-Nachhaltigkeitszielen. Wesentlicher Faktor für die Erhöhung des Schuldenstands in den vergangenen Jahren waren 2018, neben  anderen Altverpflichtungen, die Inanspruchnahme des Landes Schleswig-Holstein aus dem Rückgarantievertrag  mit der HSH Finanzfonds AöR. Dies wird auch in den kommenden Jahren die Situation beeinflussen, weshalb  die Entwicklung des Indikators weitere Herausforderungen mit sich bringen wird.

3-1-1.STAT_CONC_DEF:
## Definition:
Definition des Ziels
## Konzepte:
**Konzept 1:** All persons of working age who, during a short reference period (one week), were engaged in any activity to produce goods or provide services for pay or profit.

**Poverty Line:** Threshold below which individuals in the reference population are considered poor and above which they are considered non-poor. The threshold is generally defined as the per-capita monetary requirements an individual needs to afford the purchase of a basic bundle of goods and services. For the purpose of this indicator, an absolute international poverty line of US$1.90 per day is used.

**Household in poverty:** Households are defined as poor if their income or consumption expenditure is below the poverty line taking into account the number of household members and composition (e.g., number of adults and children).

**Working poor:** Employed persons living in households that are classified as poor, that is, that have income or consumption levels below the poverty line used for measurement.
